p: Extracts of Polyalthia longifolium (Annonaceae), used in orally consumed preparations in traditional medicine in Ghana, was investigated in order to identify anti-malarial compounds [ 68]. The protoberberine l-stepholidine ( 34, Fig.Â 9) was identified from the stem of species among the isolated compounds [ 68], but this compound had only a weak antiplasmodial activity against the K1 strain of P. falciparum.
